newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: Rough seas delay repairs to Colombo port oil terminal.
newsitem.headline: Rough seas delay repairs to Colombo port oil terminal.

text.p: Bad weather is delaying repairs to a crude oil discharge terminal outside Colombo port which was damaged in a collision with a tanker earlier this week, port officials said on Friday.
"It will take a day or two to complete repairs because the sea is rough outside the port," a port official said. "Pumping has been held up since last Tuesday."
Discharge of crude oil at the Single Point Mooring Buoy, a few kilometers off Colombo, came to a halt on Tuesday after a tanker collided with and damaged the buoy in bad weather.
Details of the damage to the buoy, meant for tankers too big to enter the port, were not available but officials said it was not serious.

A spokesman for the state-owned Ceylon Petroleum Corporation, which operates the buoy, said smaller tankers could discharge crude at a new oil berth capable of handling ships of up to 60,000 tonnes, opened in the port last month.
The CPC buys 60,000 tonnes of crude every two or four weeks.
